page.title: 02Mowsley and Laughton Houses.
page.content: There are 76 houses in Mowsley,25 in Laughton and 10 outlying farms.The { {housing}dates mainly from the 18th and 19th centuries.Both villages contain examples of medieval thatched timber framed structures;Mill Stone,Mowsley, is one example,and the locally named "Haunted House,"an empty building at the back of Mowsley church.Laughton has 2 mud-walled{cottages}which have been brick-faced.Neither village has any stone houses,the main building materials being red and blue bricks. Each village has a large{rectory}now privately owned,and a number of big houses, including farmhouses which no longer have farms attached.Most of the houses are detached,though Mowsley has a few terraced {cottages}and 10 semi-detached houses.There are 6 { {bungalows}in Mowsley and 1 in Laughton.
